description:
China&#039;s Mystery Mummies

History Documentary hosted by Rodd Houston and published by National Geographic in 2007 - English narration


Information
------------------------------

Made In China: China&#039;s Mystery Mummies

Four bodies, a scattering of clues, a mystery whose solution could force us to rewrite history. National Geographic opens an ancient case of missing persons, trying to determine the origins of a group of enigmatic mummies found in western China. What they find out may change what we know about the world. 

The four individuals were part of a vanished world that existed in western China between 2600 and 4000 years ago - long before Marco Polo or the Silk Road. Yet these long-buried corpses look like Europeans and were found with tools that didn&#039;t exist yet in that part of the world.

Who were they? Where did they come from? And how might they have affected the spread of culture and technology in prehistoric times? Spencer Wells -- a National Geographic Explorer-in- Residence -- picks up the ongoing research on the mummies found in Chinas Tarim Basin. Only now, thanks to the latest advanced DNA technology and the exclusive Genographic database, new answers are starting to come in. and along the way a better understanding of the history that bound East and West.
